intro: Zanonia philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, succulent stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
